member.summary: Contains all event handlers for the intent.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerGuilds.OnGuildCreated
member.summary: This event fires when a guild object is created. This is the best event to use for initializing the data of a server.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerGuilds.OnGuildUpdated
member.summary: This event fires when a property of a guild is changed.

member.summary: This event fires when a server is rendered unavailable, for instance, due to leaving, an outage, or being kicked/banned.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerGuilds.OnRoleCreated
member.summary: This event fires when a new role is created in a server.

member.summary: This event fires when a role is changed.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerGuilds.OnRoleDeleted
member.summary: This event fires when a role is deleted. The given object may be , so its is provided.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerGuilds.OnChannelCreated
member.summary: This event fires when a channel is created.

member.summary: This event fires when a channel is changed.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerGuilds.OnChannelDeleted
member.summary: This event fires when a channel is deleted. The given may be , so its is provided.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerGuilds.OnPinsUpdated
member.summary: This event fires when a channel's pin list is changed in any way. Discord does not include the message, nor does it include whether a message was pinned or unpinned. Isn't that grand?

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerGuilds.OnThreadCreated
member.summary: This event fires when a new thread is created. It contains a full thread object.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerGuilds.OnThreadUpdated
member.summary: This event fires when an existing thread is updated. Changes to the last_message_id field will not fire this event.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerGuilds.OnThreadDeleted
member.summary:
This event fires when a thread is completely deleted (not archived).
The threadIfExists (first) parameter can be used, but may be null, from which the other four params must be used.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerGuilds.OnThreadListSync
member.summary: This event fires when the list of threads in the server needs to be synchronized. If the second parameter ([]) is null, then this contains all threads in the entire server. Otherwise, it contains the IDs of the parent channels, from which all child threads will update.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerGuilds.OnSingleThreadMemberUpdated
member.summary: This event fires when the current user updates in a thread. It is unlikely to be used by bots, according to Discord, in favor of .

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerGuilds.OnThreadMembersUpdated
member.summary: This event fires when anyone is added to or removed from a thread.
member.remarks:
Parameters: threadID, serverID, addedMembers, removedMemberIDs
Limits: If is not enabled, this will strictly only fire for the bot itself and nobody else.

member.summary: An event that fires when integrations of the server update.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerIntegrations.OnIntegrationsUpdated
member.summary: Fires when the integrations to the server update.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerInvites.OnInviteDeleted
member.summary: Fires when an instant invite is deleted from a server or group DM. If this is a group DM invite, the guild argument will be .

member.name: T:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerMembers
member.summary: Contains all event handlers for the intent.

member.summary: This event fires when a member is added to a guild.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerMembers.OnGuildMemberUpdated
member.summary:
This event fires when a member changes (for instance, they change their nickname or the roles they have changes).
Note: In some cases, this may be desynchronized. It is strongly advised to test to determine if all of the data is present.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerMembers.OnGuildMemberRemoved
member.summary:
This event fires when a member is removed from the guild for any reason.
Note: In some cases, this may be desynchronized. It is strongly advised to test to determine if all of the data is present.

member.name: T:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerMessages
member.summary: Contains events pertaining to messages being sent, edited, or deleted.

member.summary: Messages that have been part of a bulk delete event.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerMessages.OnMessageCreated
member.summary:
An event that fires when a message is sent.
The pinned argument will be true or false to signify whether or not the message is pinned, and null if it was not sent and is therefore unknown.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerMessages.OnMessageEdited
member.summary:
An event that fires when a message is edited.
The pinned argument will be true or false to signify whether or not the message's pinned status changed (it was pinned or unpinned). It will be null if there was no change.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerMessages.OnMessageDeleted
member.summary:
An event that fires when an individual message is deleted. Messages deleted in a bulk operation will not fire this event.
This includes the message's ID. Depending on what the bot has seen, the message may still exist in memory, albeit with =

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerMessages.OnMessagesBulkDeleted
member.summary:
An event that fires when several messages are deleted at once.
This includes the messages' IDs. Depending on what the bot has seen, the messages may still exist in memory, albeit with =

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerMessages.OnDirectMessagePinStateChanged
member.summary:
An event that fires if the intent is active for when a message is pinned in a DM. This will never fire for pins in a server.
For messages being pinned in servers, see ().

member.name: T:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerPassthrough
member.summary: Contains all events that are considered passthrough (the bot will receive these no matter what, even if it has no intents defined).
member.remarks: This class is purposely left incomplete as the other passthrough events are only relevant to the bot core.

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Client.EventContainers.EventContainerPassthrough.OnVoiceServerUpdated
member.summary: An event that fires when the bot is instructed to connect to a voice server.
member.remarks:
Parameters: serverId, token, endpoint
A endpoint means that the voice server allocated has gone away and is trying to be reallocated. You should attempt to disconnect from the currently connected voice server, and not attempt to reconnect until a new voice server is allocated.

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Data.Constants.UNSENT_STRING_DEFAULT
member.summary:
A placeholder for use in payloads when a string value is not sent, and in cases where the string is also optional (to be specific, in scenarios where would have two meanings).
In general, this should only be used if is a legal value for the given text (rendering that ambiguous as well).

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Data.Constants.REGEX_ANY_MENTION
member.summary:
A regex string matches a mention to a user or role. Examples include:
User <@0123456789>
User <@!0123456789> (n.b. this is identical to the first. It used to force display the nickname of the user but this is no longer the case.)
Role <@&0123456789>
The match will have three groups. The first is the opening entry (with the less than symbol and @ / other symbols), the second is the ID, and the third is the closing symbol.

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Data.Constants.REGEX_USER_MENTION
member.summary:
A regex string that matches a mention to a user. Examples include:
Form A <@0123456789>
Form B <@!0123456789> (n.b. this is identical to the first. It used to force display the nickname of the user but this is no longer the case.)
The match will have three groups. The first is the opening entry (with the less than symbol and @ / other symbols), the second is the ID, and the third is the closing symbol.

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Data.Constants.REGEX_ROLE_MENTION
member.summary: A regex string matches a mention to a role: <@&0123456789>

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Data.Constants.REGEX_CHANNEL
member.summary: A regex string matches a mention to a user or channel: <#0123456789>

member.name: T:EtiBotCore.Data.Structs.Snowflake
member.summary:
All Discord IDs are a special object known as a "Snowflake" (see )
By default, these are encoded as 64 bit unsigned integers, but this struct exposes the extra data inside. It can be implicitly cast to and from , making certain conversions and operations incredibly straightforward.

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Data.Structs.Snowflake.DISCORD_EPOCH
member.summary: The first second of 2015. Internally, all snowflake timestamps are relative to this value.

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Data.Structs.Snowflake.Invalid
member.summary:
A constructed from a GUID of 0. Identical to .
This does not exist on Discord.

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Data.Structs.Snowflake.MinValue
member.summary: The minimum / earliest possible in existence. No s exist on Discord with a value smaller than this.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.Data.Structs.Snowflake.UtcNow
member.summary: A with its time component set to the current time. All other values are zero.

member.summary: Whether or not this snowflake is valid (that is, greater than or equal to and less than or equal to )

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Data.Structs.Snowflake.Value
member.summary: The ulong value assembled from this

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Data.Structs.Snowflake.Timestamp
member.summary:
The unix epoch timestamp of this in milliseconds, which corresponds to its creation.
Note: This already accomodates for -- This is a true unix epoch value, and is not relative to the Discord epoch.

member.name: M:EtiBotCore.DiscordObjects.DiscordObject.MemberwiseClone
member.summary: A memberwise clone of this object. This may perform a slightly-deeper-than-shallow copy of the object (in that a select handful of object reference fields are actually duplicated), but a great deal of fields will not be duplicated.
member.remarks:
Object-reference fields that are copied will be marked as such by saying This reference is cloned in clone objects. Unmarked members are to be assumed to be NOT cloned, and thus not reflective of the object's older status.
As should be implied, value types (numbers, boolean, string, so on) are always copied no matter what, so they will not say that special notice.
And of course, cloned does not necessarily imply identical, as the original object may be changed by a payload. For example, if the old object references a channel named A, and the new object no longer references it, the old object will still reference A. The thing that changes is whether A is a copy of the old A, or if it's the current A as it is right now. If A is marked as cloned, then it will be the old A.

member.name: M:EtiBotCore.DiscordObjects.DiscordObject.MemberwiseClone``1
member.summary: Identical to but provides the ability to cast into the target type.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.DiscordObjects.Factory.SendableAPIRequestFactory.FormatURL
member.summary:
The URL to the appropriate gateway location using string formatting parameters for data that might be needed for this format URL.
This should EXCLUDE the gateway domain itself, so this should be written like it shows up on the Discord API page. For example, if I want to get a channel, setting this value to https://discord.com/api/v8/channels/{0} is incorrect. It should be set to just channels/{0} (no slash at the start either).

member.summary: Whether or not this endpoint has returned an HTTP 404.

member.summary: The type of request this sends.

member.summary:
Whether or not this request will retry if it encounters gets rate limited.
Default:

The type of request that this is.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.DiscordObjects.Guilds.ChannelData.Message.IsShallow
member.summary:
Whether or not this message is shallow. In the event of a network error, this message may not exist until it is edited by the author.
When messages are edited, only minimal content is sent. If the message is not able to be redownloaded, this will be set to true, which means that it is unsafe to reference most properties.

member.summary: Replies to this message, if possible. If is , then this will be sent as a reply, from which will be used to determine whether or not to ping the user.
member.remarks: By default, specifying no will allow anything and everything to be pinged, and will also ping the person that's being replied to.
member.param: The text to send.
The embed to send.
Limitations to who or what can or can't be mentioned.

member.exception: If text is null or empty AND embed is null.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.DiscordObjects.Guilds.Member.IsAdministrator
member.summary: Returns whether or not this user is an administrator because one or more of their roles has the Administrator permission.

member.name: M:EtiBotCore.DiscordObjects.Guilds.Member.GetPermissionsInChannel(EtiBotCore.DiscordObjects.Base.GuildChannelBase)
member.summary: Returns the permissions that are allowed in the given channel. If this member has administrator, then is returned.
member.remarks:
This returns the effective permissions from their roles and the channel's overwrites to any of those roles and/or their specific user. If your goal is to acquire the overrides specifically defined just for this user explicitly, acquire it from the channel itself.
If this is called on a thread, this acts on the permissions of the parent channel (as it should), and is identical to passing in thread.ParentChannel.
member.exception: If the server this channel is in is experiencing an outage.
If the channel is not in the same server as this member object.

member.summary:
Params: channelId
JSON:
max_age: Duration of the invite in seconds before it expires, or 0 for never
max_uses: The maximum amount of times it can be used, or 0 for unlimited
temporary: If true, any users that join the server through this invite, don't get any roles, and log off, will be booted from the server.
unique: If true, don't try to reuse a similar invite (useful for creating many one-time invites)
target_user?: The target user ID for this invite (as a string)

They are created (and inherit some attributes from) an existing channel, and cannot be created independently of some parent channel.

member.name: M:EtiBotCore.DiscordObjects.Universal.Data.PermissionContainer.RegisterPermissionFor(EtiBotCore.Data.Structs.Snowflake,EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.Permissions,EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.Permissions)
member.summary:
Registers permissions for the given or on this channel with the given permissions to allow and deny. Anything that is neither allowed nor denied will be set to inherited. Likewise, anything that is wrongly registered where it both allows and denies permissions will be set to inherited as well.
If an instance of already exists for this or , then this will update the existing object. Otherwise, this will create a new object.
If you wish to set a specific permission, it is often best to call GetPermission(roleOrUser) and to directly call set on the returned object rather than calling this method every time. This throws a if the object storing these permissions is locked.
member.param: The user to add to this channel.
The permissions to allow.
The permissions to deny.
member.exception: If the object containing this is locked.
If the bot does not have the ability to modify this object.

member.name: M:EtiBotCore.DiscordObjects.Universal.Data.PermissionContainer.GetOrRegister(EtiBotCore.Data.Structs.Snowflake)
member.summary: Identical to calling , but this will register a new for the given object and return it should one not have existed previously.
member.exception: If the object containing this is locked.
If the bot does not have the ability to modify this object.

member.remarks: This only returns for user-specific permissions, or, the permissions for this object explicitly added this specific person to the list. To get the effective permissions of a given user (based on their roles), use .

member.name: M:EtiBotCore.DiscordObjects.Universal.Data.PermissionContainer.GetOrRegisterForDataPopulation(EtiBotCore.Data.Structs.Snowflake,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Forcefully gets or registers a for the given ID, for the purpose of updating from a payload.
This will return if the object is unlocked (being edited), unless forceUnlock is true. This does not set the changed flag.
member.param: Forcefully treat the object as if it's unlocked.

To read or write permissions, access this object like an array

member.summary: What this permission object applies to, which is either a role in the server's role list, or a role/member in a channel's permission object.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.DiscordObjects.Universal.Data.PermissionInformation.AllowsInherited
member.summary:
Whether or not the value is allowed for permissions. This is for permissions associated with channels, and for literal role objects.
If any permissions are set to and this is associated with a role in the server's role list, then the inherited permissions will be ignored. This means that no changes will be made to the faulty flags.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.DiscordObjects.Universal.Data.PermissionInformation.Item(EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.Permissions)
member.summary:
Get or set a given permission. The input permission must be a single permission (not a combined flag of multiple permissions).
Attempting to pass in a merged flag will raise an . Passing in will always return .
Setting something to when is will not change the value.
member.exception: If this is part of a and the object is locked.
If the input permissions enum is undefined.
If the bot does not have the permissions necessary to alter permissions.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.DiscordObjects.Universal.ReactionContainer.RawReactions
member.summary:
The reactions that have been added to this message in their raw form.
These only store the actual emojis on the message and the amount of emojis that were added. This does not container member information (who added the emojis).
member.remarks: This may be more reliable than and . This is because data sent by Discord does not always include the members associated with a reaction (unless explicitly requested).

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.DiscordObjects.Universal.ReactionContainer.ReactionsByEmoji
member.summary: The reactions on this message indexed by the emoji that one or more users may have added. Each emoji corresponds to a list of the users that have reacted with that emoji.
member.remarks: This risks being out of sync from . Discord does not send who reacted by default, only what the reactions are and how many there are.

member.name: P:EtiBotCore.DiscordObjects.Universal.ReactionContainer.ReactionsByUser
member.summary: The reactions on this message indexed by a user that has added one or more reactions. Each user corresponds to a list of the emojis they have reacted with.
member.remarks: This risks being out of sync from . Discord does not send who reacted by default, only what the reactions are and how many there are.

member.name: M:EtiBotCore.DiscordObjects.Universal.ReactionContainer.AreReactionsDesynchronized(EtiBotCore.DiscordObjects.Universal.Emoji)
member.summary:
Checks if the reactions for the given emoji might be desynchronized by looking at the amount of users in compared to the count for this emoji in .
In short, this tests if and agree with eachother in terms of how many people reacted. This may not be perfect, but it should be a good enough gauge for typical usage.
member.param: The emoji to check for desyncs.

member.name: M:EtiBotCore.DiscordObjects.Universal.ReactionContainer.DownloadReactions(EtiBotCore.DiscordObjects.Universal.Emoji,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Downloads the reactions for the given emoji including user information, and populates , , and with the data.
This will test unless is .
By default, if the amount of downloaded reactors is less than or equal to the amount of users that are registered to have reacted right now, the list of reactors will be replaced with the downloaded list to ensure the list is as clean as possible. If the amount downloaded is less than the amount of registered reactors, the list will not be cleared (because that would throw out some reactors) unless is .
member.param: The emoji to acquire.
The amount of users to acquire. Maximum 100.
If , the reactions will be downloaded anyway.

If is less than the amount of reactions stored right now, and if this is , the registry will be replaced with the new downloaded list instead of merged. This will effectively discard a number of reactors, but guarantees the list is as clean as possible.
member.exception: If is null.
If is less than 0 or greater than 100.
If the request fails and the reactions could not be downloaded.

member.name: M:EtiBotCore.DiscordObjects.Universal.ReactionContainer.AddReactionFrom(EtiBotCore.DiscordObjects.Universal.User,EtiBotCore.DiscordObjects.Universal.Emoji)

member.remarks: This does not send a network request, and is exclusively for internal storage.

member.summary: Shit hit the fan and Discord has no idea what happened. Try again lol.

member.summary: YE FOCKED UP. Invalid !

member.summary: YE FOCKED UP. Bullshittin on json encoding or message length.

member.summary: You sent a payload before identifying.

member.summary: The token with your identify payload was incorrect.

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.DiscordGatewayEventCode.AlreadyAuthenticated
member.summary: YE FOCKED UP. You sent two or more identify payloads.

member.summary: Voice Only. This session is no longer valid.

member.summary: The sequence number given with a resume was not correct.

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.DiscordGatewayEventCode.RateLimited
member.summary: Bro holy shit lol slow down

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.DiscordGatewayEventCode.TimedOut
member.summary: You know how you try talking to an old guy and he just kinda zones out? You just did that to Discord.

member.summary: The shard sent when identifying was malformed.

member.summary: This bot would have handled far too many servers, and so you will need to shard your bot before you can identify.

member.summary: The version of your API is invalid.

member.summary: The intent was invalid.

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.DiscordGatewayEventCode.NotAuthorizedToUseIntentOrVoiceDisconnected
member.summary: An intent you're implementing is one you are not authorized to use. Did you remember to enable it in the bot's dashboard? Are you verified + allowed to use it?

member.summary: Voice Only. The server crashed. Our bad! Try resuming.

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.DiscordGatewayEventCode.UnknownEncryptionMode
member.summary: Voice Only. Your encryption mode was not recognized.

member.summary: Represents a gateway intent, which describes what data the bot wants to receive.

member.summary: An invalid gateway intent. Attempting to send this will result in a response of 4013 / INVALID PAYLOAD.

member.summary: All intents packaged into a single value.

member.summary: All intents that are privileged and must be enabled in the bot's configuration.

member.summary: All DM-related events.

member.summary: All guild-related events that are not privileged.

member.summary: All guild-related events, including privileged events. Use to exclude privileged events.

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.GatewayIntent.DEFAULT
member.summary:
The bot intends to receive no special data.
As a result, the bot will only process the events that Discord sends by default (which are not locked behind any intents):
READY
RESUMED
VOICE_SERVER_UPDATE
USER_UPDATE

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.GatewayIntent.GUILDS
member.summary:
The bot intends to listen to or send events for core guild events. Included events are:
GUILD_CREATE
GUILD_UPDATE
GUILD_DELETE
GUILD_ROLE_CREATE
GUILD_ROLE_UPDATE
GUILD_ROLE_DELETE
CHANNEL_CREATE
CHANNEL_UPDATE
CHANNEL_DELETE
CHANNEL_PINS_UPDATE

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.GatewayIntent.GUILD_MEMBERS
member.summary:
The bot intends to listen to or send events for guild membership events.
This is a privileged event and must be explicitly enabled in the bot's control panel.
Included events are:
GUILD_MEMBER_ADD
GUILD_MEMBER_UPDATE
GUILD_MEMBER_REMOVE

member.summary: A faulty that will never be sent by Discord.

member.summary:
An event was dispatched.
This operation is: Received

member.summary:
Fired periodically by the client to keep the connection alive.

member.summary:
This operation is only used in voice connections.
Select the protocol used to connect to voice.

member.summary:
Starts a new session during the initial handshake.
This operation is: Sent

member.summary:
Update the client's presence.
This operation is: Sent

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.PayloadOpcode.VoiceHeartbeat
member.summary:
This operation is only used in voice connections.
A voice heartbeat.

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.PayloadOpcode.VoiceStateUpdate
member.summary:
Used to join/leave or move between voice channels.
This operation is: Sent

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.PayloadOpcode.Speaking
member.summary: Only used in voice connections. This payload contains information about speaking.

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.PayloadOpcode.Resume
member.summary:
Resume a previous session that was disconnected.
This operation is: Sent

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.PayloadOpcode.VoiceHeartbeatAcknowledged
member.summary:
Only used in voice connections. This is the opcode for an acknowledged heartbeat.
This operation is: Received

member.summary:
You should attempt to reconnect and resume immediately.
This operation is: Received

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.PayloadOpcode.VoiceResume
member.summary:
Only used in voice connections. You are attempting to resume an existing voice connection that has failed.
This operation is: Sent

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.PayloadOpcode.RequestGuildMembers
member.summary:
Request information about offline guild members in a large guild.
This operation is: Sent

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.PayloadOpcode.VoiceHello
member.summary: Only used in voice connections. Equivalent to for voice connections.

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.PayloadOpcode.InvalidSession
member.summary:
The session has been invalidated. You should reconnect and identify/resume accordingly.
This operation is: Received

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.PayloadOpcode.VoiceResumed
member.summary:
Only used in voice connections. The successful response to .
This operation is: Received

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.PayloadOpcode.Hello
member.summary:
Sent immediately after connecting, contains the heartbeat_interval to use.

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.PayloadOpcode.HeartbeatAcknowledged
member.summary:

member.name: T:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.PermissionState
member.summary: The state of a permission.

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.PermissionState.Allow
member.summary: When configuring permissions, this means it is on.

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.PermissionState.On
member.summary: An alternative name for mnemonic purposes in role permissions.

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.PermissionState.Inherit
member.summary:
When configuring permissions, this means that it will inherit the value within the associated role.
Alternatively, if this applies to a user, it will inherit the total permissions of the user (whatever their top role sets).
It is important to note that permissions are calculated via a bit-wise OR. In Layman's terms, in your role configuration menu (the one for the entire server), once it's on, it will *stay* on for all higher roles (of course, this is based on what roles someone actually has, not what roles exist). For example, if I have a role called "Member" that allows viewing channels, and above it a role called "Muted" that has the little switch turned off, if someone has both of those roles, they will still be able to see channels because Member turned it on, and once it's on, it stays on. The only way to overwrite this is to change channel permissions.

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.PermissionState.Deny
member.summary: When configuring permissions, this means it is off.

member.name: F:EtiBotCore.Payloads.Data.PermissionState.Off
member.summary: An alternative name for mnemonic purposes in role permissions, as turning off a permission for roles does not necessarily deny it - if a different role turns it on and a user has both roles, then it will be on.

member.name: M:EtiBotCore.Utility.Extension.StringExtensions.GetStringBetween(System.String,System.Char,System.Char,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Given text, this method will find the first occurrence of and .
If both exist and end is after start, it will return all characters between these two (NOT including them)
If this case is not met, is returned.
Example: GetStringBetween("[Hello, world!]", '[', ']') returns Hello, world!
member.param: The string to search.
The character that marks the start of the result.
The character that marks the end of the result.
Starts the search after this character index.

member.name: M:EtiBotCore.Utility.Extension.StringExtensions.GetStringBetween(System.String,System.Char,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Given text, this method will find the first occurrence of , and the second occurrence after that.
If both exist, it will return all characters between these two (NOT including them)
If this case is not met, is returned.
Example: GetStringBetween(":Hello, world!:", ':') returns Hello, world!
member.param: The string to search.
The character that marks the start and end of the result.
Starts the search after this character index.
